p: Apart from efflux pumps and biofilm formation, another mechanism that contributes to drug resistance in bacteria is plasmid conjugation. Bacteria can disseminate plasmids harbouring genes responsible for drug resistance to other bacteria through plasmid conjugation [ 12]. Inhibitor of bacterial conjugation for specific plasmids such as pKM101 can therefore be of use to reduce drug resistance. Amphiphilic compounds are known to inhibit bacterial plasmid conjugation and as compound 4 is amphiphilic, a plate conjugation assay [ 12] was carried out in order to determine its inhibitory effect on bacterial plasmid conjugation in Escherichia coli.
